main event: On May 21, 1949, a call was received reporting a flying saucer over the Hanford Area, approximately four miles east of the Hanford Atomic Plant in Washington.
interesting points: The flying saucer was observed standing still before taking off in a southeasterly direction at a speed greater than that of a jet fighter.
A round, white or silver object was visually observed traveling in a northeasterly direction at a speed greater than that of a jet fighter, at an estimated altitude of 10,000 to 15,000 feet.
An F-82 aircraft was scrambled to intercept the flying saucer, but radar contact with the unidentified object was spotty and inconclusive.
Hanford operators reported falling bits of paper in their area, which were later identified as advertisements for an Air Rodeo at Richland.

There were two separate and distinct alert conditions on the day of the observation, one caused by the sightings of flying saucers and the other by the dropping of leaflets by an aircraft, with no apparent connection between the two events.
witnesses: Various observers including Hanford operators and military personnel
